title: The Walking Dead producer teases Michonne return for Rick Grimes movies
text:
Michonne is leaving in the upcoming series of The Walking Dead (Picture: AMC)

The Walking Dead producer Denise Huth has teased whether Michonne could make an appearance in the Rick Grimes movies.

The upcoming tenth season will see Danai Gurira’s Michonne leave the show after seven years, although it’s unclear if she will be killed off altogether.

As fans know, leaving The Walking Dead doesn’t always mean the end – with Rick Grimes (Andrew Lincoln) returning for a trilogy of movies set within the same universe following his exit.

This has opened speculation over whether Michonne could also return considering she’s Rick’s significant other, and while show producer Denise claims the decision is with chief content officer Scott Gimple who oversees the franchise, she wasn’t exactly ruling out the possibility.

Speaking to Metro.co.uk, Denise said: ‘I can’t say a whole lot but Michonne is such an important character, along with Rick obviously.

‘As a fan myself there’s always that I want to see both of them again however we get to do that. She’s a hugely significant part of this upcoming season, and the overall universe and the stories planned all exist in the head of [chief content officer] Scott Gimple. He has his plans of what will happen and we don’t always even know how it’s going to go.

Could Michonne reunite with Rick in the movies? (Picture: AMC)

‘But for me personally as a fan, if there’s a chance of seeing Michonne again either here in the movie, or whatever else they come up with, I would be very excited to see that happen.’

A big indicator of whether Michonne could return depends on when the Rick Grimes movies will be set in the timeline, with his initial departure followed by a timeline jump in the show of six years.

Michonne hasn’t seen Rick throughout that whole period, so unless they use flashbacks or the movies are set beyond events in season 10, it could be tricky for her to make a return in a logical way.

A trilogy of movies around Rick, however, would feel odd without Michonne’s inclusion considering how important they’ve been to one another, so we’ll just have to see if Danai’s departure will hold some answers on the matter.

Danai’s exit marks the third major departure from the show in recent years following Rick and Carl (Chandler Riggs), which has drastically changed the material the show pulls from Robert Kirkman’s comics.

‘Those are three hugely important characters in the comic book that made it basically to the end,’ Denise said. ‘So to have those iconic characters not here, it definitely changes how the writers approach the story, and looking at what stories we can tell from the comics [that] we can adapt to a different character; how we can evolve a story from the comic book to make sense without those very important characters here.

Michonne, Judith and Rick in The Walking Dead (Picture: AMC)

‘It’s hard of course, I miss all of them. It’s weird not to think of them being here all the time. But it also is kind of exciting because it opens up possibilities for the storytelling and I think anytime we can adjust the comic story and evolve it and change it, it’s exciting as a fan.

‘The comics always exist as the comics, that story never changes. It’s always there to go back and be reread and be enjoyed, so it gives us freedom and flexibility with the show to surprise audiences and maybe do a different character in a different way because we can tell a story from the comic in somebody else’s eyes. That’s always really cool to do.’

Avi Nash, who plays Siddiq, also recently spoke to Metro.co.uk about what to expect from Michonne’s exit and the upcoming tenth season.
